review: Turn down the music PLEASE! Most annoying songs ever at full blast. Food is good but hard to enjoy when you're sitting next to the sub woofer.

Sitting at the bar and Karen, my bartender, was AWESOME. She was attentive, and this place is packed. She's funny and on top of her game. As a frequent Southwest flier, I'll be back, and I'll ask for Karen.  Food wise I'm familiar with CPK and ordered a BBQ chicken salad and some wine. Everything was delicious as always.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!! 1st there isn't a ton of food options for the Southwest Terminal 1, so you're pretty much stuck paying $20 for a personal pizza. I stood in line for 15 mins to order a BBQ Chicken pizza just to have the manager tell me it would take about 10 minutes to be ready, i said fine knowing my plane was about to start boarding in 20 minutes, i waited for about 12 minutes to come ask the other cashier if she has any idea where my pizza is, she said the cook hasn't even made it yet and it will take another 15 mins. I look over to see that the cooks literally haven't even started on the order yet and is making cheese pizza. I waited for 5 more mins after that but still seeing that the pizza isnt being made and they are not in a rush at all, i decided to take the plane cheese pizza instead and head over. The crushed pepper was empty and when I asked the cashier if she has anymore, since this was empty, she seemed like she could care less. The manager was taking orders on the other register and seemed like was in la la land and would rather be at a different place.  Since this location is at the Airport, you would think that they would care for other people's time and try to deliver the order to the customer soon since they have flights to catch but the staff there is just straight up lazy and would rather be elsewhere then work at this CPK. So disappointed and pissed!!!
CPK has some pretty good pizza and some different takes on both classics and non-traditional pizzas.  I think they need to reinvent their pizzas a bit as there's a lot more competition now.

Not a ton of options in the Southwest Terminal 1 at LAX, so I went with old reliable CPK to go. Disappointed that Thai Chicken isn't one of the 4 choices, but mushroom & pep is always good.  I literally did a DOUBLE- take when I saw my pizza was gonna be $18.29 + tax. I have heard of expensive airport food, but this is outta hand!! I got a Coke Zero and my total was over $23 for a single serving pizza and a Coke!! That's WAY more expensive than a freakin Lakers game!! Well, at least if I spend that money, I'm gonna get some good pizza- right?! WRONG! My toppings were literally all crammed in the very middle of the pizza!  You can literally see sauce on over 1/3 of my pizza that's not covered in: cheese, mushrooms, or peporonis?!  Get it TOGETHER people!! Only reason they get a 2-star rating is because the staff taking orders is super friendly & super fast (which I appreciate in an airport)

Hmmm. This was a classic case of "Beggars can't be choosers" for me. This is a review for the grab and go pizzas. If you're looking for a review of the actual sit-down dining experience, I unfortunately cannot speak to that. I was arriving at LAX for a late night Southwest flight out of Terminal 1. With everything under construction, all of the food options have changed, so CPK it was for me. I wanted something I could grab pretty quickly since my flight was about to board, so I hopped in line for CPK. One good thing about this CPK is that they recognize that people at airports can generally be short on time, so they have pizzas ready made and boxed for you to take on your plane with you. That being said... these pizzas are grossly overpriced (I mean $17+ for a smallish personal pizza??) and clearly have just been chilling under the heat lamps in the boxes for a while.  And yes, I know... when you're dining at an airpot and you're in a hurry, what are you expecting? I generally like CPK when I go the regular, non-airport CPKs for a sit down meal, but I can't bring myself to give this CPK a stellar review. The margherita pizza that I ordered was essentially a cheese pizza with some basil on it. No tomatoes, no garlic, no additionally mozzarella cheese. Because I've eaten at regular CPKs, I KNOW they can do better. tl;dr: Beggars can't be choosers. I'd come back here again to grab a pizza to go if I was really in a rush, but be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for a pizza that's been sitting there for a while and is not up to normal CPK standards.

Decent food eats, convenience is all we care about while we are flying out of the LAX via Southwest Airlines. Now why haven't we tried you locally here in Sactown? Maybe bc ours is not located at our airport.  Remembered the first time we were here before it was time for breakfast. I had the sausage breakfast bagel that hit the spot. We took it to go so we weren't treated the same as if you were eating in the restaurant like we did recently. That's the reason for the four stars instead of five. Hubby had the BBQ chicken salad and I had the Cobb salad. It overall was pretty tasty & on point. I loved how they separated all the ingredients. Just ask my hubby that I eat items separately. I know it's very unusual. Maybe bc I'm very organized in my mind! I wished we could have taken it to go though. I couldn't finish it all but of course our flight was delayed so that nixed that idea. Great service was definitely a plus for sure! At least we know this for the next time. Remember three's a charm? It's bound to happen! LOL

I came off my terminal and was heading towards my next plane. I wanted to get something to eat before I sat in next plane ride (4 hours long). This was on my way to my next plane. I did not to other places as I wanted to grab something quick to eat. In other words I did not order a pizza or anything hot. I actually got one of their premade meals. I had the option of a sandwich or a salad. I decided on the sandwich since I needed something to last me. I got the pesto chicken. It took a while to get my meal checked out as a lady was in front of me asking the cashier question. They had two cashier but only one open. Eventually, they opened the second one and processed my meal. The bread of the sandwich was pretty thick in my option. The bread seemed to make The whole experience of meal seemed dry. The pesto was spread fairly enough on one side of the bread. The chicken was not too dry but enough. The sandwich stay together for the most part as I surprising ate it pretty clean (in other words, did not really spill)

We are here while waiting for our flight. And even though this is a hotel restaurant....I was very impressed with the service.  We told our waiter from the jump that we were probably gonna have to "eat and go." He made sure to rush our order in, and cash us out right away. He understood we were probably gonna be in a hurry and he took care of us no problem. Now, I'm sure he is used to do this, but we have all been to restaurants where they just didn't understand the urgency of the check.  Not only that, our food was delicious!! I don't expect much from an airport. But the food was crazy good and our cocktails were pretty damn good too. Very impressed.  Of course, you are in a airport. The food was definitely over priced...but what's new in an airport? The food was great, the cocktails were perfect, and the customer service was on point! I'm definitely a fan. :)

We were greeted by a server named Bethlehem. She has no emotions and looked like she didn't care to be there. We ordered the first time she came over to us and the pizza took about 45 minutes to come out. Thankfully our flight was delayed or we'd almost miss it. I ordered a second glass of wine and it never came. Just not a good experience overall. We should have stayed at Reilly's, they had friendly staff and good drinks.

Shockingly, I actually had good wait service here. That's almost unheard of for an airport eatery.  They even had fresh-brewed iced tea (something I kept struggling to find during my time in California). Pizza was also very good. I'm not sure why anyone would order anything here except pizza. Keep in mind that this is an airport, so prices will be elevated. Practice a little airport common sense and save yourself some frustration. If you don't have at least an hour until your flight boards, then don't bother ordering from places like this. Go hit up some airport fast food instead.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!  I ordered over priced food at the counter, went to sit and enjoy my very expensive meal, and the manager made my son and I move twice, saying only dine in customers could sit at the tables.  But I was dining in after making a food purchase.  There was no sign indicating any difference for types of seating, and he was so aggressive and rude.  I went and got a refund, and will never purchase from there again.  Horrible experience.  They weren't even busy, the place was practically empty.  I felt singled out and harassed.

Finally they have been doing a lot of remodeling since I last flew out of terminal 1. The restaurant options had changed a bit and I ended up at California Pizza Kitchen to eat a late lunch. Most of the employees working here seemed very unorganized and not well trained for each of their positions. I'm going to guess that most of them were all new hires. Once I got seated at a small table, I started things off with an iced tea. Then I ordered their Sicilian pizza. *Sicilian Pizza* I almost never ever order a pizza, but hey, it's in their name... when in Rome! It turned out to be a very tasty delicious pizza! Just the right size, however it was a bit pricey at about $19. Fortunately my waitress was pretty good. She was nice and refilled my iced tea when it was getting low. Overall I wouldn't mind eating here again as long as the food remains good, but they probably need to work on their employees and get them to do their jobs instead of checking their phones in the presence of customers.

The food was decent but the service was very mediocre and our meal was very pricey (but that's a given inside an airport). I was really excited about there being a California Pizza Kitchen in the middle of a small, domestic terminal (terminal 1) -- wasn't expecting there to anything but fast food. Food: Our family ordered the bbq chicken pizza, the chicken avocado club with a side salad, and the kung pao spaghetti (without meat because adding chicken/shrimp was an extra $3). The BBQ chicken pizza was decent, but nothing exceptional. I was actually pleasantly surprised by the Kung Pao Spaghetti -- I usually don't like "Asian" food served at restaurants not run by Asians but the noodles were very flavorful without being overly salty/sweet. The chicken avocado club and side salad were also decent. 4/5 Service: I think we saw our server twice the entire meal -- once when he came to take our order and once to deliver the check. Other than that, he never came by to refill our water (food and drinks were delivered by someone else), didn't even give us silverware (we had to flag down a random waiter to get our silverware), and never gave more than curt answers/never made eye contact when he did come by. 1/5

Got a margherita pizza (safe choice) and the quinoa salad since we figured this was pretty safe.  The pizza took a little time to come out so if you think you'll be pressed for time, i'd go hit up the to go boxes.  We had a little over an hour so we sat down.  Service was pretty slow, but the food was ok.  Airport pricing so don't get sticker shock.

First time eating from this place and it was quite delicious. I had the garlic cream fettuccine with chicken and it was very good. The guac and chips were yummy as well. The service is good, can get quite busy. The wait may be a little long,  but at least there's a full bar and tvs.

Good ol' CPK at LAX... opening VERY late.  They were set to open at 4:30am... how did I know... well, a gentleman came out at 4:15am and told me and the other 4 people waiting in line. Sounds good, I saw the huge Starbucks line and would rather wait here. 15 min goes by, and nothing, 30 min goes by and still nothing. The workers completely ignored us. I overheard another one of the 20+ people now in line, as about the hold up, and they said "we are waiting on the manager to bring up cash". The patient customer then asked how long it would be, and the worker said "they are on their way"... so another 15 min goes by and still nothing!!!! Someone finally came up with the cash, and they opened up at 4:55am without any apology to the 5 of us that waited over 50 min to get a breakfast sandwich and a coffee (everyone else gave up their wait). NEVER AGAIN will I be here, even with the very limited selections here at LAX.

Stopped by for some grab before heading on the plane in terminal 1, which is new and clean, rare for LAX!! The drinks came out after a little delay and the food came out after that, not to come here if in a hurry for sure...but if you have 40+ minutes, nice place for strawberry lime margarita and couple glasses of wine!! The BBQ chicken is always a good hit...the margharita pizza is fantastic!!

CPK is just going to rip you off at the airport- you might be insane if you want to eat at this one - $17.81 for a crappy cheese pizza or $18.99 for one with bbq chicken or meat and guess what - they are always out of any pizza with any meat.   The pizza will look like someone geometrically challenged tried to make an amoeba but failed, and gave in by throwing in the towel along with half a handful of cheese on top.   It's nice to have a Monopoly and a captured audience thank you LAX for the brand spanking new digs, not impressive.

Service from Guillermo at the bar was outstanding! I'm so glad they updated from their stall at Terminal 1 to a sit down location. Food came out pretty quick, but the berry sangria was delish! Airport dining is not budget-friendly at all but the CPK brand is pretty reliable in terms of consistency...you always know what you're gonna get there. Expect high prices, good service is a bonus!
Favorites are always best !  BBQ chopped salad !  BBQ chicken pizza.  Great service !!  Always room for a cup of tea and dessert!

Bought pizza in the "take out" but was told my soup would take 30 min to make so I went to the "dine in" area and asked if I could sit and eat my pizza while I waited for my soup. I got the response "Um, actually, no. You can't." So you're telling me I just spent $20 on a tiny pizza and $10 on a soup and can't even sit at the establishment I bought it to eat? The Latina hostess with blonde hair is rude and unprofessional.

I stop here every other week before my flight and will say it's worse each time. My visit two weeks ago my food was over cooked and the balance was cold so they offered me a 10 percent discount for a breakfast I did not eat. So let's try again walk up half of the tables haven't been cleaned and I'm told you'll have to wait   Finally they cleared one table so I could sit but as I look around there's still 4 dirty tables and have been this way for at least 15 min.  Hopefully something new opens in SW terminal so there's other options. Second time the cook couldn't cook eggs correctly and they still served them. Ordered eggs sunny side up and one the top under cooked and the bottom hard. The toast is only toasted on one side.  That's laziness on my part. They need to stick to pizza.

Absolutely terrible. I rarely dish out 1 star reviews but this one was asking for it. This place is as chaotic as it can get. No one knows what is happening, the ordering system is messed up, no follow through on orders and I can go on and on..! A simple order for a Barbecue Chicken Pizza which they promised in 10 mins took for ever and my little one went to sleep. No one smiles, everyone looks at you like you are a botheration. Everyone that ordered after me got their food. They promised to call my name which they totally forgot. The gal at the counter would not make eye contact because she knew she messed up.. Major training inputs required.
Good food, beer and okay service.  Wanted to have a pizza but worried I'd have time to eat it while relaxing before my flight.  Overall a good experience but food was average.

Breakfast was good but for airport breakfast it was great!! Service was very good and very prompt. Breakfast potatoes were a little in greasy side but coffee and omelette were very good. Breakfast sandwich was good too.
Great place for quick pizza before getting on plane. They are quick and efficient in the to-go line. Food fresh and pretty tasty for airport food. Staff super friendly too

This CPK is located in the SWA terminal. Although I love CPK's bbq chicken pizza, we weren't in much of a pizza mood, so we opted to get apps. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, chicken dumplings, and shishito peppers. The spinach and artichoke dip was pretty standard. The chips definitely came straight out of a tostitos bag. The honey glaze on the chicken dumplings gave the dish flavor, otherwise the dumplings thenselves would have been bland. My favorite appetizer is the one with the shishito peppers. I always order the shishito peppers as an appetizer at any restaurant that serves them, because I like to compare how each restaurant dresses them up. I enjoyed the oil/salt/seasoning on the shishito peppers of the appetizer. My friend ordered the ginger smash cocktail, and Oof... Really heavy on the ginger.
Food was good. Service was quick, but nothing special. Prices were on par with airport eating.

This was the only positive in the eyesore of the under construction LAX terminal 1. It is new and fresh looking and we barely had to wait for a table. Although if you prefer, they have quick service too.  I got the brie and turkey sandwich and my husband got a bbq pizza. He got beer and I got a citrus cocktail which was made perfectly and much needed after our disaster of a day trip we had. The food took a bit to come out but our waitress was very nice and we were happy to sit there and just rest our feet. I'd definitely eat dinner here again because it tastes great and feels like a little piece of heaven in the middle of such a chaotic airport.

If you like cold pizza and price gouging then you have Come to the right place! Welcome to LA! Oh and we ask that you Pay double for a frozen cheese pizza over what we charge at our ordinary chain eateries in the mall.  But then, we all have business cards and expense accounts and that's really why everyone is in line and ordering. It's a business expense. It's not like that $20 pizza is coming out of your pocket. Stick it to the man! Get two! So when in terminal one waiting for your southwest flight, go ahead and Wait in the line. Order the pizza and soda, sit back and enjoy the people watching. Just remember when you return to fill out that expense report because nothing says "regert" (tattoo commercial joke) like paying for crappy frozen pizza out of your own pocket.  Safe travels.
I'm sorry but $13.83 for a "super spinach & quinoa salad" is ridic. I know it's the airport but sheesh. Feels like the rape pat down I just got from TSA coming through security.
Bartender are fantastic! Quite expensive for what you get, but its to be expected in an airport. They serve tall pints of beer for 10$ which isn't too bad!

If you are looking for a value then keeping looking, you won't find that here. Pizza will run you ~$16 and is meant to be personal. You could split a pizza, but if you've got a long flight ahead of you then you might want to reconsider.  On the other hand, I still rated this highly because the pizza was pretty good. We only got the BBQ chicken pizza, so I can't attest to anything else. Staff was friendly and service was quick. Bonus points for having phone chargers near most seats.

Terrible. Usually it's okay, but this time, just no.  Ordered margherita pizza, should have green, white and red on it, called my name, it was just cheese. Went up to cashier to make sure we got the right pizza, cashier said looks like cheese but verified that it was margherita. My friend got HER margherita, had basil on it. Had to both go up to get it done right.  More than 13$ for a pizza, a bit much, esp since mine was missing toppings, and it wasn't even made right. Margherita pizzas should have mozzarella, tomato slices, and basil. They tried to pass off a cheese pizza + basil as a margherita. Mm. No. If you aren't vegetarian or don't like margherita, then just get something else. But don't expect much. When I've gotten their buffalo chicken pizza in the past, it was good, but still not that much on toppings. Think minimal. Great for fashion, not for food.

I used to love flying through LAX so that I could visit California Pizza Kitchen. However this morning I was completely disappointed by them to the point that I feel insulted.  For $12, do you think they could at least serve an edible breakfast sandwich? With ovens blazing in the kitchen, why did they microwave my sandwich to death until I couldn't chew it, the bread was so tough? I can tell that they do not give a **** about their customers, who are trapped in an awful terminal with almost no other food options.  I wish I could give this nasty sandwich back for a refund. Regrets.  Never again will I support this business.

No stars.  Plain awful food.  No one seemed happy with the offerings no matter what direction I looked.  You eat it bc you're hungry, not because it's at all good.  Had Cobb Salad, all ingredients pale, listless, and as soon as I felt tinge of fullness, it was over!

Slow workers and very impatient cashiers, bordering on rude. I get that you only sell a couple things and it's frustrating when customers don't immediately understand that, but your format is so different from standalone California Pizza Kitchen restaurants that it takes customers a second to reorient themselves from what they originally expected. Plus it's like $13 for a 10" personal pizza. Not worth it at all.  Would not recommend.

Had breakfast there this morning. I was disappointed with the cleanliness of the place. All the chairs were fabric covered and stained with God knows what. The coffee was horrible. Tastes like it was two days old. Mind you we were there when they just opened for business.

You know after a 13 hour flight into LAX from Australia we we're looking for a good quick bite before our next flight. 5 people working behind the counter and they are all chatting and carrying on like there's not 15 people waiting - talk about careless, inefficient and down right poor service. Not to mention the prices. $4 water $4.50 juice $10 breakfast sandwich and atrocious coffees.  This place is one to avoid and does the CPK franchise a disservice.

Probably the best place in LAX (that I've seen in this part of the airport at least). Yes, the pizza is going to be expensive for the size. It's an AIRPORT. What did you expect? Tastes great, and Javier and Alejandro were very nice and willing to make a strawberry mojito for me despite it now being on the drink list. Good service at the bar!

Absolutely terrible! They couldn't get the oven working so no option for the breakfast pizza. Maybe something you should warn people as you seat them? It's not called California Kitchen. Also no potatoes available. 15 minute wait for a server to get our order and that's when we were notified of the items they didn't have or could not make. 20 minutes later we get our food. My sandwich was missing the avocado and someone else I was with was given cold eggs and they forgot his sausage, which they did not bring out until we were done eating everything else. Had to go to the bar ourselves to get refills. Very poor management. The manager was just pacing around instead of directing his crew or speaking with guest. Good thing my flight was delayed or we wouldn't have gotten to eat at all.

One of the best food options in the Terminal 1 food court.  The other food court restaurants are hit or miss, but this CA Pizza Kitchen is good--polite employees and they're fast considering they bake every pizza.
15 minutes wait in line only to be told that pastry in the window is only for show and they only have cookies. Not even apologising for it. If you're out let people know!

Pizza was what I would expect. I got the mushroom pepperoni mushroom pizza (one of the few choices) which taste the same as other locations I have been to... Tasting and extra think crust, just how I like it! One I got up to the register, she boxed up my pizza and it was piping hot out of the brick oven. Although, I do Wish they offered more choices, but I guess this is expected since its in an airport (terminal 1).

It now costs $16.79 for a BBQ Chicken pizza. The new location looks nice but the prices are insane and you still have to wait 10-15 minutes for a table. With the almost complete lack of restaurants in Terminal 1, I guess this is one of your only food options so you might as well suck it up and pay the exorbitant prices just to get a place to sit down. Why they decided to put an empty Brookstone and a ridiculous massage place in this terminal instead of more food options or places to sit is beyond me.
Grabbed breakfast. Was right for what we were looking for and our service was very good. The breakfast sandwich was a great size and very filling.
Don't get breakfast here, burrito is heated in the microwave, paper sticks to it and it falls apart.
Stood in line for ages then didn't even bother.  Pizza didn't look appetizing and I was tired of waiting.

This was the best pizza I have had in forever! The pizza was immediately ready and it was a breath of fresh air! The service was very prompt and polite and the food was hot and ready. I will be returning.

Horrible, small portions, slow service. Had 30 minutes were told would have pizza in 10 minutes 30 minutes later no pizza. Told us 25 minutes after we ordered that one of the items we ordered for our kids was not available. Leaving not enough time to get anything for our kids before we boarded. Avoid this worthless restaurant. Had to board plane with barely enough food for 2 people because weren't ready in time. And had 6 people to feed. Horrible service. Staff was non apologetic. Worst experience in long time, how this classless establishment remains open is beyond me. DO NOT ORDER anything from this place unless you have at least an hour and then only order if you enjoy horrible service. Should not be in an airport.
Breakfast was pretty good, especially for an airport location, but the service was lacking. Was surprised that the coffee was good.

I usually like CPK. Terminal 1 - 1 hour before flight and I needed breakfast.  Overly microwaved breakfast burrito for $11.  Horrible.  Hot lava cheese and microwaved bacon and eggs.  Did I mention that it's microwaved past the point of being edible? Not fit for human consumption.

With service this bad...bring on the robots. No one greeted us at our table for 15 minutes (airport customers have time restrictions because of things called flights). It got so bad that I got up from my table and walked to the bar to order food and to take the drinks back to my table. But I ended up back at my table as I finally saw our server. Once we ordered, the drinks and food were on time and quite good. But you need utensils and napkins to enjoy them. I asked the hostess and she said "one second", which ended up being never. I went to the bar and the bartender scoffed at me but I managed to squeeze two sets from him before raiding the hostess stand for another (because my travel companions tore a napkin in half just to share). Our server came by and asked how everything was, but moved on with "good" before we could answer. If you're overpaying in an airport it is because of expedited service, and if you can't handle the airport hustle...you should just go back to your cushy stucco strip mall locations.

Wow $31 for a very dry unappealing pizza and salad with no fork...yuk While I was waiting for my flight, I saw lots of people that seemed tired and resigned with those doggone boxes in their laps.  They all kept eating but with looks of disgust and disappointment on their faces.  It was so sad.  One guy's pizza was completely burned and he just kept eating.   the snacks that I brought for myself were taken away because they were more than 3 ounces so that was part of the problem but I want to make it clear to Cal Pizza Kitchen that their is NO excuse.  I will never try one of their places again...
There is not a CPK in this building. I know, because I work here and theyve been gone for some time. The corporate office was here, but never a restaurant. Someone should correct the address.

Food poisioning :-( Ate here last friday after traveling overseas. Had no issues during our entire trip then we order what we expect to be good, clean american food. We both thought the cheese tasted funney and within 6 hours my wife and I were completely sick, i still have vomiting, nausea and D after 4 days. Thanks CPK!
It's an airport, so I expected the delay one can say;however, I did enjoyed the service they offer. I had the best laughs and careness from the servers

After trying the CPK tortilla soup at the Oakland Southwest terminal two days before, I decided to stop at this CPK to compare its tortilla soup with the one that I had found lacking in Oakland.  I found that LAX's version was marginally better than its twin up north.  Not only that, but I was totally in the mood for something calling itself a soup after eating a very filling late breakfast a few hours before.  Bottom line: this place seems really OK, though I have to admit that the ambiance in the food court where it's located is not especially uplifting. I honestly wished for something better, but I couldn't find anything else that was more promising in Terminal 1.
Had a 2 hour delay and was hungry! Stopped in for the original BBQ. Service was great and fast even with line. Pizza was quite tasty. Kudos for a grade A airport lunch!

My weird egg-bacon-sausage breakfast pizza (see below) was pretty yummy. Was it worth $14?  Hecka no.  Was it special in any way?  Honestly, not really. It was a bacon and sausage pizza with scrambled eggs crumbled on top. Was I sad that they randomly didn't have their breakfast burritos or their "Denver" pizza available on the Wednesday morning that I was here? Yes. This is literally one of two places where you can get non-coffee, non-dessert food in Terminal 1. If I had to do it all over again, I probably would, but that doesn't mean I'm happy about this airport trap.

Terminal 1 doesn't have a lot of food options so I settled for CPK. Ordered a hearty (but airport priced - $10.99) breakfast burrito. It basically somehow tasted like pizza in a burrito which wasn't really a bad thing...eggs, chunky bell peppers, onions, sausage, bacon & best of all...melty cheese!  While it was microwaved, it retained a lot of it's moisture and I thought it was pretty good. Breakfast is served until 10am!
Ordered a cheese pizza while waiting for our flight.  It was ready within minutes. The crust was thin and crispy the way I like it. The pizza was hot and fresh and we loved it!

I'm very disapointed. Had to wait for 25 min to get in (not too many other options at the airport), only to have the waitress telling me that they were out of 3 out of 3 things I ordered. Very pricey too and not very clean.

Service sucks.. and seriously cpk... the prices... wtf??and the white corn guacamole... maybe would be ok if it wasn't served w corn chips... way to much corn... just put avocado and onion  in quac you cheap asses!!!

I've been really excited to try this new location out at the southwest terminal, but Yikes...the food is and always has been amazing at any CPK I have been to...but the service here at this particular location was really bad:/ I contemplated posting this because I really try to give every customer service situation the benefit of the doubt, but I just couldn't. Yes, this place was very busy at the time I sat down...but it took about 15 minutes after I sat down before anyone even came up to take my order or greet me. I ordered my food, which again I've stated was awesome as usual, spinach-quinoa salad and margherita pizza, but then it was served to me without utensils and napkins. It took about a good five minutes before it was given to me, in which that case it was just thrown down on my table without any apology, as if I had inconvenienced them for asking for it. Cuz I guess, supposedly I'm supposed to eat my salad w my fingers and wipe my mouth with my sweater...right?? Duh silly me. During the time I ate and enjoyed my food, I never once got asked how my meal was and if there was anything else I needed...booooooo. As someone who worked as a server for all my highschool years, trust I know how the food industry and service is supposed to be handled. So no, you can't fool this chicky...nor get away with bad service since I have been there myself at one lifetime. Towards the end of my meal there was one server who wasnt even assigned to my table who was very attentive...Dante...cool as shit. Totally saved my crappy visit at the very end of my sit down. Thanks! Will I never come back here again? No...I am hoping it was just one bad night and experience for me...will I blast this on my twitter? Nah...I've had worse service elsewhere, but definitely much better service in many other places. I'm really super chill and not hard to please. So if I sell out and actually post a not so great experience on Yelp, you know you done wayyyy wrong, kid. The butter cake tho...amazing. Just hope service is better next time

CPK is like an oasis in a Desert in the food court of LAX Terminal 1 when compared to other options available. I'm not a great fan of CPK but at-least you get fresh pizza made to order that comes to you piping hot. I got the Thai Chicken pizza ($12.89) and a naked juice smoothie ($5.25) so prices are exactly double of what you would pay outside but that is common across all spots in the food court. After ordering I was expecting a long wait as CPK seemed to be the preferred choice of most travelers which resulted in a long queue but surprisingly the wait was under 10 minutes. As expected I was not a great fan of the taste of the Thai chicken. It seemed to have some sort of bland tomato sauce masquerading as a Thai sauce which I felt sucked as it is not difficult to create a simple hot and sweet tomato based sauce that would be more representative of Thai flavor. Anyway they toss a bunch of thinly sliced carrots along with a sprinkling of sprouts to make up for the lack of Thai flavor. They do accept cards but are one of the few restaurants that do not take Amex. Of-course the server did not know this and instead loudly proclaimed that my Amex was declined so that was not pleasant (quickly fixed by providing another card). Looking at the larger picture and comparing this CPK location to other options available, I would probably still pick CPK the next time I'm flying through Terminal 1.

Stopped here with one of my coworkers for some food before our flight, we were asked if we had at least two hours which we did so we proceeded to sit down. We waited 5 minutes before a female server came to take care of us, she took our order and dropped off our drinks. Then another server brought us out food and took care of us after that point. The food was enjoyable. We weren't checked on at all while eating.  We finished eating and sat for roughly an hour before our server finally came back to see how we were doing, he got us boxes but had someone else drop them off and then asked us if we were ready for the bill. I work in the service industry so I understand the usual, being busy etc but that wasn't the case here. They don't have too many tables to take care of. I'm not usually one to complain but the service just wasn't up to par.

Really varies by location. I have had excellent meals and excellent service as well as lack luster meals and soso service. I do like the wide range of choices on the menu. There are some fun choices here. If I have a choice of a good Mom and Pop .... I would go there.
Be warned...  $73 (with tip) for one bowl of kung pao spagetti (chicken and shrimp) plus two cadillac margaritas.  Repeat... $73.

CPK is usually such a good place that we just assumed it would be good here. The menu is extremely limited, most of what we ordered wasn't available, prices were high, even for airport standards. Plus we waited eternity to get in here.  I'll avoid this place in the future, but unfortunately I was duped this time.

This restaurant is SLOW, and the attendants don't pay any attention to you.  And then, it is expensive!  At the airport, you would expect that everything will be quick.  This one is very slow.  I had to raise and waive my hand high to get any attention to get seated , to order, to ask why food is late, and to pay.  Then, the bill is a surprise.  The menus is misleading but you have to pay more than $22 for pasta with shrimp and chicken, and $10 for a glass of house wine.  Beware.  Don't go unless you have time and money to waste.
EUUGH. Bad pizza. I know it's airport pizza, but really!? The tomato sauce was horrible, the cheese was bad, the crust was pretty bad, too. At least they had some local beers!

Pizza and Beer for breakfast! Yes, why not?? With an hour between flights at like 10:00 am, I decided to grab a bite. I was very pleased. Having never eaten at a California Pizza Kitchen, I didn't know what to expect.  It's about an 8 or 9 inch personal pizza, which you COULD share, but I ate all but one of 6 slices myself. They're pretty small and dainty.  I had the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza, and some kind of a citrus beer in a can which could have been colder. Everything came out to like $17.00.  Super good.

Stuck in terminal 1 with a layover? Find this place in the food court, close to the terminal exit. I almost missed seeing the food court. You have to walk pretty close to the security area in order to see it tucked around the corner to the right. Came by to grab a late lunch around 3pm. Line at CPK ASAP was short. Ordering was quick, small selection for pizza options. Estimated wait time was accurate. 10min for a fresh pizza. You can see them put in fresh pizza into the fire oven. It's pricy, but expected with airport prices. $12.99, after tax 14.16. The size of the pizza was probably about 11" just a guestimate. I would've had half a pizza for left overs but I didn't want to have to carry the box around, so I ate the whole thing! Looked like a fatty stuffing my face, lol, but it's ok I wasn't going to arrive at my destination until 11 pm, ate enough for the day!  There were plenty of seats available in the food court when I was grabbing my late lunch. Tables were kept pretty clean.

Pizza is always good but the lady working today is running late and she's being rude to customers telling them she's not open yet.  The posted hours of operation state 5 am but when I asked her she said 5:20.  Apparently she's behind and she sets her own hours. Oh and I finally got to order and she tells me they aren't serving pizza until 7!  Then in front of a long line asks me if I paid for my banana and tea! Like I was stealing. I purchased them from the cafe next door.  Total bitch! She needs to be fired

The people were friendly but can't figure out an order for the life of them. I ordered a sausage pepperoni and mushroom pizza.... I was given a mushroom pizza, which I noticed when I arrived at my gate. I walked back over to let them know, they very quickly exchanged it. When I got to my gate and boarded the plane, I opened the box and was again given the wrong pizza.... this time just pepperoni. Very frustrating given the pizza I ordered was more expensive and there was no time for me to go back. If you eat here make sure to check your order before walking away

Ugh. So disappointed in this spot. They have NOTHING. No pita and humus & no bread for my soup, flys everywhere.... But Really, no bread? Cray. My Drink took 7 mins to arrive. This is a slummed down version of CPK. Won't be back here. Sad.

We arrived at this CPK in the LAX Southwest terminal after about 10 minutes. After we sat down and ordered 2 Cokes, we were then told that they were unable to serve any pizza. How can they call themselves CPK if they cannot serve pizza!!! We were not told by the "hostess." We paid for our cokes and left. As we left, I told the people in line that they are unable to serve pizza. The supposed "hostess" made some snarky remark about me not needing to tell people. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! I wouldn't give it a single star if I could.

CPK has closed in the food court. It's now called Basil Torn. the pizzas are smaller and still $10. The menu is even more limited now.  I wouldn't bother. The good news is a bigger CPKi is opening in the  terminal in the near future.

Horrible horrible service every time I come here. I swore I wouldn't come again after last time, but I caved, and ended up having a worse experience than the time before. Do not come here unless you have a minimum of an hour to kill. Based on a half dozen or so visits, it always takes over 10 minutes after you're seated for somebody to come by and take your order. If you're ordering an alcoholic drink, expect another 10-20 minutes before that drink arrives. As far as your food, expect it 20-40 minutes after your order. You'll finish your first drink by then, but your server will not come by to ask if you'd like another drink. If you're lucky you can flag them down. Your food will be brought out by somebody who isn't a server, and can't take your order for a second drink.  The food is fine, drinks are good, selection is more than adequate. Service is just so awful that nothing could make up for it. When you mention the delay to your server they complain about how big their section is, a large party of people, or how busy they are. They absolutely never apologize or say anything to put you at ease. When I mentioned the 15 minute wait for my drink order this time I got the busy/large party excuse, and the waitress then the waitress pointed out another person and said they'd been waiting longer. That would be even worse than my 15 minutes, but I specifically saw that table get cleared and that exact person sit down. So it was a blatant lie, and again, no apology or anything to put me at ease. Just lies, excuses, and complaints.  Hopefully I'm never foolish enough to come back here again, but I'm at this airport in this terminal dozens of times a year, and there aren't many options. They kind of know you're stuck with them and act like you're lucky they even serve you at all. It leaves me feeling taken advantage of every time. A simple apology for being so busy would alleviate everything, but they don't care.

Service was pretty slow for an airport location, which was fine as I had time to burn. The white corn guacamole is like a 1/5. The BBQ chicken salad is 5/5. Our waitress was super nice. Good TVs for watching NBA playoffs. If you're flying southwest and have 45+ min before you board, why not?

California Pizza Kitchen. Extremely popular with some of my friends for their fire oven baked pizzas. This terminal doesn't offer many food options. For hot food, not the cold sandwiches and salads, there was a sports bar and CPK. I've been here during lunch time and the line is crazy long and the wait even longer. The stove can only make so many pizzas at once! From the end of the line to getting your pizza, it's take over an hour.  I came back during breakfast hours. There was no line and pizza came out in ten minutes. Pizza is hot and fresh. Cheese would string with every bite, which is messy but I know a lot of cheese lovers like the oozing cheese. On this morning visit, staff were playful and cheery. Good food that is overpriced...but hey it's the airport.

I had the shishito peppers here before and they were so good. It was my first time trying them. But the second time I got them here, they lacked the flavor they had the first time, and BURNED MY MOUTH SO BAD! Now keep in mind I am mexican so I can generally take heat and spice pretty well... not this time. There were a quite a few that I just couldn't bear to even take the smallest bite out of. Makes me worry about people that can't even take a good amount of spiciness like me... They would wanna die from these bites! Also, they stopped making my favorite avocado cocktail so I'm bummed about that too.. But seriously, warn people about these peppers! I can't even finish my leftovers my mouth is on fire!
Incredibly slow.  Food not prepared well. Terminal 7 is much better (if you want Pizza kitchen and can stand the walk).
Great food and service! We got two salads and a pizza, all delish! As far as the menu goes, there aren't many options though.

This is no longer CPK but now a place called "Torn Basil."  Whereas CPK was a notch above other airport food court joints, the new thing is maybe the worst thing I've ever eaten at an airport. After eating I feel uncomfortably bloated, yet still hungry. I hate myself for eating here.  Pro tip: when you put a turd in a coalfire oven*, what comes out is a coalfired turd.  *actually just gas grill shaped like a brick oven.

Great chef!  Five stars for food!  One star for service. What in living hell is wrong with your waitstaff.  We ordered breakfast. The food bar none excellent.  Had to ask refill of coffee but got cold tea poured from tin cup by the hostess.   Waitress Beth was not polite. Barely looked at us and didn't check on us for refills. She questioned our food voucher from Southwest Airlines(canceled flight). She questioned the validation date (had to show her when it expires) then she made an incorrect calculation on the bill.     Beth needs to go; she is hurting your business.  This may have been a great experience. We will skip this place at LA airport location.  There other places you can go get breakfast. Such a shame.The California Pizza chefs are awesome.
Nice food, a little higher than normal airport expensive, terribly slow service and the pizza oven is broken...and they didn't tell anyone till after we were all seated and had decided on the menu.

The line wasn't too bad so I thought i'd give it a go.  The trick is to look behind the counter where all the pizzas have already been cooked and boxed and choose something that has to be cooked fresh. (Who knows how long those other pizzas have been sitting there?) I went for the BBQ chicken pizza and the cashier told me it would be out ten minutes. (Just enough time to go over to Gordon Biersch and grab a pint.)  It came out, she called my name, and the pizza was super hot.  Flavor was good and it filled the spot.

Ok so I travel in and out of la regularly on sw airlines and there are not a lot of options here for good but this place by far has the best quality good and decent service. I've been here several times now and scant day that I've ever had outstanding service but certainly  not horrible.   It is what it is. Airport service, slightly better than average airport food and decent selection of mommy juice
Absolutely disgusting.   Crispy dynamite shrimp was soggy and gooey.  Normally one of  my favorites at other locations. Berry Sangria was good though.  Service was rushed and crappy.

I am at terminal 1 at LAX now with plenty of time to kill, and decided to get some breakfast. They have a decent selection to choose from and I decided to get the Sonoma omelette, which had basil, egg white, a little bit of Parmesan and a nice bit of fresh smashed avocado. The dish also came with fresh fruit. The service was prompt and very friendly
Pizza was good well cooked and had vwry good taste. For an airport restaurant i highly recommend it.
Now called "Torn". The pizza was jokingly tiny, like a child's size. Yet  $11. The buffalo chicken was ok, but I'm still hungry.  What the heck.
Got delayed at the air port and got to have drinks and supper. Nice place to eat and relax!

Probably the most pointless destination in the airport. Waited in line to find out that pizzas were a 45 minute wait (despite the fact that I saw no pizzas at all), sandwich choices were 1 of 2, and seating after ordering the 1 menu option was gated to the suckers sitting down. Bad form, bro, pizza is in the name. Wtf.

Food was fine, but customer service sucks. Server was openly eating gummy snacks on the service floor. Bartender was on his cell phone behind the bar. Host was walking around drinking from his coffee cup. Why bother having a "restaurant" portion? Tip: just do take out.
What a bas experience. Rude and obnoxious staff with no interest in serving patrons. Do yourself a favor and walk 50 yards further and  visit one of the other restaurants.
Love CPK, well this airport location is yes brand new, but somehow they forgot good old fashion service.   Prices up there with the airplanes, sky high.
I admit this CPK can be a pain to get to with the airport traffic on Century, but if you want to grab a quick bite with people who aren't getting boarding passes, this is a fairly decent spot.

Wolfgang Puck should be ashamed of himself.  This was our only option in the terminal, and it's clear to see they don't care that they are the only game in the area.  The service was terrible; rarely do I get terrible service, too.  I could see them making the pizzas, so I knew I could order without cheese for me.  The pizza I wanted (sausage, mushroom, pepperoni) was not what the lady at the counter wanted me to order, apparently.  She barked it was not available.  I tried to get more info on why, as I saw them custom make pizzas.  Finally the communication broke through and there was no sausage.  She offered me no other option, just looked annoyed at me for needing to eat.  I got a plain pepperoni for me, and a cheese pepperoni for my husband.  Perhaps the worst pizza I've ever eaten.  I barely ate half of it, and only ate it because I was hungry.  I might mention that I did feel ill a few hours after consuming this pizza made with despite.   Even if you are ravenously hungry in the Southwest terminal at LAX, do your intestines a favor and skip this place.

***I went to this LAX California Pizza Kitchen ASAP for breakfast and had their breakfast burrito, which was awful; I did not know this when I ordered, but the breakfast burritos were just lying around and they are heated up; the burrito was filled with a greasy and unappetizing mess and it was too hot to eat because of how long the breakfast burrito was zapped in the microwave; the wait time was quite long; I think they have more made-to-order breakfast items (and pizzas are available during breakfast) that are probably much more satisfying*** This CPK ASAP is located past security in the Southwest terminal at LAX so it is only open for air travelers.  Parking at LAX is expensive like other airports.
Service was slow and the food was cold. Over priced. Terrible food !!!!  For the amount of money they charge you would hope to have a decent meal. Server was either new or didn't care.
Hot garbage. Line was busy today, so they were sending out pizzas without cooking them all the way.  I ended up with mush. Cook it right or don't cook it at all.

Quick food for all the airport travelers. This mini CPK offers some of the great variety of options found at CPK restaurants. There is a mini fridge that offers cold sandwiches and salads  to grab and run. Then there is the hot tortilla soup and Pizza that are made to order. Freshly handmade warm pizza baked right in front of your eyes through a wood oven. This is a very tiny location located in the food area of the airport. The line goes fast and the wait time is not bad. The pricing is going to be much more than the traditional restaurant pricing.
The guy at the counter was super friendly and helpful. The pizza was made fresh-to-order. The pizza tasted better than expected.

CHECK YOUR BANK ACCOUNT STATEMENTS after you go to this restaurant!!!!!  On 1/22 my 3 friends and I went to this location (Manhatten Beach) as we have gone several times in the past. Dinner was good, everything seemed fine. When the bill came, we split the amount 4 ways, the total for us all was $35 per person (which included tax & tip) 2 paid cash while the other two of us paid with our debit. I told the waiter to charge the two cards $35 each, the rest was cash and the change was his tip (20% because he seemed nice). He did that (So at least we thought). We left the restaurant everything was fine. Come a week later when I noticed on my bank account that I was charged $40. I called my friend who also had paid with a CC and the same thing happened to her. On January 30th, she called the restaurant and the manager, Walter Hastey, sure enough found the receipt. He emailed them to her for confirmation and we found out that not only had the waiter changed the amount, he had re-printed the receipt, and signed it as well! That was an extra $10 for our order plus committed forgery by signing our names! The manager, Walter Hastey, acknowledge the error to my friend and said that "the conversation with the waiter was going to be awkward" What about the customer who he committed fraud too??? Isn't that more awkward?? Yes it was only $5 each, but HE REPRINTED AND SIGNED OUR NAMES!!!!  How many times has this guy done it to customers before??????? He also said he would give both my friend and I a $30 Gift Card each for what we went through. Later that morning, I called the CPK Corporate offices (310-342-5000) to let them know what was going on at their establishment in Manhatten Beach, which I had to leave a message...twice!I received NO call back so later that evening I called the same manager , Walter Hastey, of restaurant my friend had spoken to, to ask what the outcome of the waiter was. At first he was NOT apologetic at all, he sounded bothered that I had called and he acknowledged that corporate had re routed the message to him. Keep in mind, I was one of the victims and he had never spoken to me before. When I told him it felt worse that I'm calling about the situation and he sounded bothered, he then changed his voice to sound like it mattered. He also told me that he was trying to make it right by sending us the gift cards like he told my friend(which he said would be put in the mail that night). He asked for my personal info so he can send mine directly to me (which now I dread giving it to him!) Well as of now, neither one of us has received anything! I'm not even sure to be honest that the waiter has been let go. he probably just got moved to another location! All I can say CHECK YOUR STATEMENTS FOR ANY PREVIOUS DINNING EXPERIENCES HERE! And as you can see, if there is any issues with CPK, neither the management nor corporate takes it seriously! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE GUYS! I will be happily posting this to all CPK close to the area just incase the waiter was just moved to another restaurant location to make people aware of your company's business values and not let this happen to someone else again. CPK needs to teach their management that simple follow through will always help keep unsatisfied customers coming back. ESPECIALLY when fraud is involved by someone they hired!

I have to say this may be the worst terminal for food options that I've ever seen. I was going to get a breakfast sandwich at the place next door, but when I saw the price, I decided it wasn't worth it. The sports bar had like 3 sandwiches and 4 salads. Pathetic. Pizza it is! And it was good! The pepperoni was very tasty. I love CPK and this airport location did not disappoint.

To be frank, I opted for California Pizza Kitchen because going from terminal 1 to 5 in LAX would have required me to go through security again in order to get Lemonade, I overheard some girls saying they'd go for a salad here, and based on the populous place, I figured so many people couldn't all be settling for sub-par meals, could they? I ordered the barbecue chop salad and quite honestly, I think I could have taken a dumpster dive for a healthier, greener-looking salad. The lettuce was an atrocious white-brown with some sprinklings of dark green leaves. I'm not even sure, but I would have imagined the chicken would be hot but instead it was fresh out of the refrigerator. Maybe it's just me, but I take my $14 salads seriously. The service was as you'd expect given that it's a busy airport terminal restaurant but I can certainly attest that this will be my first and last trip to CA 'Za Kitch. All in all, I don't recommend bothering with this joint for the salads--go straight for the carbs, ladies and gents.

Nice place to grab a bite if your flight is delayed or if you have extra time to kill.  It's not the fastest, but it's still pretty comparable to the pizza at the freestanding locations.  They have limited pizza choices and don't offer Honey Wheat dough. The pizza is a bit smaller than the ones at the restaurant and slightly more expensive.  I didn't mind though.  I got to eat my pizza, have a Stella and watch the Lakers game at Gordon Biersch next door.  I'd definitely have CPK ASAP again if time allowed...it's better than the other fast food choices in the area.
I ordered one of their breakfast sandwiches and it tasted like heated cardboard.  Actually, I think I'd rather eat cardboard.

Terrible service and they were out of everything. I ended up having to order a plain cheese pizza which was very blehhhh... Plus after ordering three of these tiny pizzas the total came to $42 dollars...

Great alternative to other rather unhealthy airport food options. Loved that they have some of their best salads that are available and they are really fresh.  They also have a good assortment of other decent snacks you can pack along on your flight!  And the fact they are next to a Starbucks makes it all the better!  :)
It's fast, fresh, and tasty... for the airport.

I was happy to have this option at LAX.  Pizza was freshly made and served piping hot, but it does come with a wait, so don't order if you're short on time.  Prepared Chinese Chicken salad was less than tasty, mostly because of the chemical taste to the overpowering dressing.  Staff was not really friendly, which is atypical of CPK.

This place is pretty meh. I mean really meh. It's located in the middle of the food court right after the security checkpoint (Southwest and US Airways) with a ton of other things.  I had the works pizza (personal pizza size) and a Naked juice... Which came out to be about $16... Ugh. Luckily this was on company dime... Or I would've skipped lunch all together. Then again, this is typical airport pricing... So maybe it's not a big deal. The wait for food was about ten minutes (only redeeming point is that they make it "fresh"), but the food court it's in is really gross and not cleaned very well... Would not recommend this place unless you were dying of hunger... It's the only quick place that's not absolutely stomach turning in terminal 1. The pizza dough is really gross... Like frozen... isn't really reminiscent of it's better half (a real California Pizza kitchen). I could barely make my way through the whole thing... though it was rather large for a personal pizza. The ingredients they put on the pizza weren't bad, but the dough just killed it in my opinion... then again, this is a express version of a chain restaurant...
Worst breakfast sandwich ever! Chunks of egg, crumbles of bacon and microwaved to disgusting. Staff was friendly tho'

One star because it is California pizza. Other than that, ordering is a mess. Make sure to double check your order as well- they gave me the wrong order and made me wait an additional 10 minutes for the correct one. No sense of urgency just Unorganized chaos

Ordered a plain cheese pizza. I can't imagine making it any better. Cooked perfectly, crust somewhere between thin and deep dish, and baked just right to be a slight bit chewey. Great-tasting sauce. And Just the right amount of cheese. Really perfect. It's about a 10-inch pizza, so really good for a quick "slice" for two, or a hungry "one." Done in about 10 minutes and about $10-$11. Awesome!
Umm....hello people...this isn't a resturant...this is a Corporate Location.
Turn down the music PLEASE! Most annoying songs ever at full blast. Food is good but hard to enjoy when you're sitting next to the sub woofer.

location: Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, United States
review: Sitting at the bar and Karen, my bartender, was AWESOME. She was attentive, and this place is packed. She's funny and on top of her game. As a frequent Southwest flier, I'll be back, and I'll ask for Karen.  Food wise I'm familiar with CPK and ordered a BBQ chicken salad and some wine. Everything was delicious as always.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!! 1st there isn't a ton of food options for the Southwest Terminal 1, so you're pretty much stuck paying $20 for a personal pizza. I stood in line for 15 mins to order a BBQ Chicken pizza just to have the manager tell me it would take about 10 minutes to be ready, i said fine knowing my plane was about to start boarding in 20 minutes, i waited for about 12 minutes to come ask the other cashier if she has any idea where my pizza is, she said the cook hasn't even made it yet and it will take another 15 mins. I look over to see that the cooks literally haven't even started on the order yet and is making cheese pizza. I waited for 5 more mins after that but still seeing that the pizza isnt being made and they are not in a rush at all, i decided to take the plane cheese pizza instead and head over. The crushed pepper was empty and when I asked the cashier if she has anymore, since this was empty, she seemed like she could care less. The manager was taking orders on the other register and seemed like was in la la land and would rather be at a different place.  Since this location is at the Airport, you would think that they would care for other people's time and try to deliver the order to the customer soon since they have flights to catch but the staff there is just straight up lazy and would rather be elsewhere then work at this CPK. So disappointed and pissed!!!
CPK has some pretty good pizza and some different takes on both classics and non-traditional pizzas.  I think they need to reinvent their pizzas a bit as there's a lot more competition now.

Not a ton of options in the Southwest Terminal 1 at LAX, so I went with old reliable CPK to go. Disappointed that Thai Chicken isn't one of the 4 choices, but mushroom & pep is always good.  I literally did a DOUBLE- take when I saw my pizza was gonna be $18.29 + tax. I have heard of expensive airport food, but this is outta hand!! I got a Coke Zero and my total was over $23 for a single serving pizza and a Coke!! That's WAY more expensive than a freakin Lakers game!! Well, at least if I spend that money, I'm gonna get some good pizza- right?! WRONG! My toppings were literally all crammed in the very middle of the pizza!  You can literally see sauce on over 1/3 of my pizza that's not covered in: cheese, mushrooms, or peporonis?!  Get it TOGETHER people!! Only reason they get a 2-star rating is because the staff taking orders is super friendly & super fast (which I appreciate in an airport)

Hmmm. This was a classic case of "Beggars can't be choosers" for me. This is a review for the grab and go pizzas. If you're looking for a review of the actual sit-down dining experience, I unfortunately cannot speak to that. I was arriving at LAX for a late night Southwest flight out of Terminal 1. With everything under construction, all of the food options have changed, so CPK it was for me. I wanted something I could grab pretty quickly since my flight was about to board, so I hopped in line for CPK. One good thing about this CPK is that they recognize that people at airports can generally be short on time, so they have pizzas ready made and boxed for you to take on your plane with you. That being said... these pizzas are grossly overpriced (I mean $17+ for a smallish personal pizza??) and clearly have just been chilling under the heat lamps in the boxes for a while.  And yes, I know... when you're dining at an airpot and you're in a hurry, what are you expecting? I generally like CPK when I go the regular, non-airport CPKs for a sit down meal, but I can't bring myself to give this CPK a stellar review. The margherita pizza that I ordered was essentially a cheese pizza with some basil on it. No tomatoes, no garlic, no additionally mozzarella cheese. Because I've eaten at regular CPKs, I KNOW they can do better. tl;dr: Beggars can't be choosers. I'd come back here again to grab a pizza to go if I was really in a rush, but be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for a pizza that's been sitting there for a while and is not up to normal CPK standards.

Decent food eats, convenience is all we care about while we are flying out of the LAX via Southwest Airlines. Now why haven't we tried you locally here in Sactown? Maybe bc ours is not located at our airport.  Remembered the first time we were here before it was time for breakfast. I had the sausage breakfast bagel that hit the spot. We took it to go so we weren't treated the same as if you were eating in the restaurant like we did recently. That's the reason for the four stars instead of five. Hubby had the BBQ chicken salad and I had the Cobb salad. It overall was pretty tasty & on point. I loved how they separated all the ingredients. Just ask my hubby that I eat items separately. I know it's very unusual. Maybe bc I'm very organized in my mind! I wished we could have taken it to go though. I couldn't finish it all but of course our flight was delayed so that nixed that idea. Great service was definitely a plus for sure! At least we know this for the next time. Remember three's a charm? It's bound to happen! LOL

I came off my terminal and was heading towards my next plane. I wanted to get something to eat before I sat in next plane ride (4 hours long). This was on my way to my next plane. I did not to other places as I wanted to grab something quick to eat. In other words I did not order a pizza or anything hot. I actually got one of their premade meals. I had the option of a sandwich or a salad. I decided on the sandwich since I needed something to last me. I got the pesto chicken. It took a while to get my meal checked out as a lady was in front of me asking the cashier question. They had two cashier but only one open. Eventually, they opened the second one and processed my meal. The bread of the sandwich was pretty thick in my option. The bread seemed to make The whole experience of meal seemed dry. The pesto was spread fairly enough on one side of the bread. The chicken was not too dry but enough. The sandwich stay together for the most part as I surprising ate it pretty clean (in other words, did not really spill)

We are here while waiting for our flight. And even though this is a hotel restaurant....I was very impressed with the service.  We told our waiter from the jump that we were probably gonna have to "eat and go." He made sure to rush our order in, and cash us out right away. He understood we were probably gonna be in a hurry and he took care of us no problem. Now, I'm sure he is used to do this, but we have all been to restaurants where they just didn't understand the urgency of the check.  Not only that, our food was delicious!! I don't expect much from an airport. But the food was crazy good and our cocktails were pretty damn good too. Very impressed.  Of course, you are in a airport. The food was definitely over priced...but what's new in an airport? The food was great, the cocktails were perfect, and the customer service was on point! I'm definitely a fan. :)

We were greeted by a server named Bethlehem. She has no emotions and looked like she didn't care to be there. We ordered the first time she came over to us and the pizza took about 45 minutes to come out. Thankfully our flight was delayed or we'd almost miss it. I ordered a second glass of wine and it never came. Just not a good experience overall. We should have stayed at Reilly's, they had friendly staff and good drinks.

Shockingly, I actually had good wait service here. That's almost unheard of for an airport eatery.  They even had fresh-brewed iced tea (something I kept struggling to find during my time in California). Pizza was also very good. I'm not sure why anyone would order anything here except pizza. Keep in mind that this is an airport, so prices will be elevated. Practice a little airport common sense and save yourself some frustration. If you don't have at least an hour until your flight boards, then don't bother ordering from places like this. Go hit up some airport fast food instead.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!  I ordered over priced food at the counter, went to sit and enjoy my very expensive meal, and the manager made my son and I move twice, saying only dine in customers could sit at the tables.  But I was dining in after making a food purchase.  There was no sign indicating any difference for types of seating, and he was so aggressive and rude.  I went and got a refund, and will never purchase from there again.  Horrible experience.  They weren't even busy, the place was practically empty.  I felt singled out and harassed.

Finally they have been doing a lot of remodeling since I last flew out of terminal 1. The restaurant options had changed a bit and I ended up at California Pizza Kitchen to eat a late lunch. Most of the employees working here seemed very unorganized and not well trained for each of their positions. I'm going to guess that most of them were all new hires. Once I got seated at a small table, I started things off with an iced tea. Then I ordered their Sicilian pizza. *Sicilian Pizza* I almost never ever order a pizza, but hey, it's in their name... when in Rome! It turned out to be a very tasty delicious pizza! Just the right size, however it was a bit pricey at about $19. Fortunately my waitress was pretty good. She was nice and refilled my iced tea when it was getting low. Overall I wouldn't mind eating here again as long as the food remains good, but they probably need to work on their employees and get them to do their jobs instead of checking their phones in the presence of customers.

The food was decent but the service was very mediocre and our meal was very pricey (but that's a given inside an airport). I was really excited about there being a California Pizza Kitchen in the middle of a small, domestic terminal (terminal 1) -- wasn't expecting there to anything but fast food. Food: Our family ordered the bbq chicken pizza, the chicken avocado club with a side salad, and the kung pao spaghetti (without meat because adding chicken/shrimp was an extra $3). The BBQ chicken pizza was decent, but nothing exceptional. I was actually pleasantly surprised by the Kung Pao Spaghetti -- I usually don't like "Asian" food served at restaurants not run by Asians but the noodles were very flavorful without being overly salty/sweet. The chicken avocado club and side salad were also decent. 4/5 Service: I think we saw our server twice the entire meal -- once when he came to take our order and once to deliver the check. Other than that, he never came by to refill our water (food and drinks were delivered by someone else), didn't even give us silverware (we had to flag down a random waiter to get our silverware), and never gave more than curt answers/never made eye contact when he did come by. 1/5

Got a margherita pizza (safe choice) and the quinoa salad since we figured this was pretty safe.  The pizza took a little time to come out so if you think you'll be pressed for time, i'd go hit up the to go boxes.  We had a little over an hour so we sat down.  Service was pretty slow, but the food was ok.  Airport pricing so don't get sticker shock.

First time eating from this place and it was quite delicious. I had the garlic cream fettuccine with chicken and it was very good. The guac and chips were yummy as well. The service is good, can get quite busy. The wait may be a little long,  but at least there's a full bar and tvs.

Good ol' CPK at LAX... opening VERY late.  They were set to open at 4:30am... how did I know... well, a gentleman came out at 4:15am and told me and the other 4 people waiting in line. Sounds good, I saw the huge Starbucks line and would rather wait here. 15 min goes by, and nothing, 30 min goes by and still nothing. The workers completely ignored us. I overheard another one of the 20+ people now in line, as about the hold up, and they said "we are waiting on the manager to bring up cash". The patient customer then asked how long it would be, and the worker said "they are on their way"... so another 15 min goes by and still nothing!!!! Someone finally came up with the cash, and they opened up at 4:55am without any apology to the 5 of us that waited over 50 min to get a breakfast sandwich and a coffee (everyone else gave up their wait). NEVER AGAIN will I be here, even with the very limited selections here at LAX.

Stopped by for some grab before heading on the plane in terminal 1, which is new and clean, rare for LAX!! The drinks came out after a little delay and the food came out after that, not to come here if in a hurry for sure...but if you have 40+ minutes, nice place for strawberry lime margarita and couple glasses of wine!! The BBQ chicken is always a good hit...the margharita pizza is fantastic!!

CPK is just going to rip you off at the airport- you might be insane if you want to eat at this one - $17.81 for a crappy cheese pizza or $18.99 for one with bbq chicken or meat and guess what - they are always out of any pizza with any meat.   The pizza will look like someone geometrically challenged tried to make an amoeba but failed, and gave in by throwing in the towel along with half a handful of cheese on top.   It's nice to have a Monopoly and a captured audience thank you LAX for the brand spanking new digs, not impressive.

Service from Guillermo at the bar was outstanding! I'm so glad they updated from their stall at Terminal 1 to a sit down location. Food came out pretty quick, but the berry sangria was delish! Airport dining is not budget-friendly at all but the CPK brand is pretty reliable in terms of consistency...you always know what you're gonna get there. Expect high prices, good service is a bonus!
Favorites are always best !  BBQ chopped salad !  BBQ chicken pizza.  Great service !!  Always room for a cup of tea and dessert!

Bought pizza in the "take out" but was told my soup would take 30 min to make so I went to the "dine in" area and asked if I could sit and eat my pizza while I waited for my soup. I got the response "Um, actually, no. You can't." So you're telling me I just spent $20 on a tiny pizza and $10 on a soup and can't even sit at the establishment I bought it to eat? The Latina hostess with blonde hair is rude and unprofessional.

I stop here every other week before my flight and will say it's worse each time. My visit two weeks ago my food was over cooked and the balance was cold so they offered me a 10 percent discount for a breakfast I did not eat. So let's try again walk up half of the tables haven't been cleaned and I'm told you'll have to wait   Finally they cleared one table so I could sit but as I look around there's still 4 dirty tables and have been this way for at least 15 min.  Hopefully something new opens in SW terminal so there's other options. Second time the cook couldn't cook eggs correctly and they still served them. Ordered eggs sunny side up and one the top under cooked and the bottom hard. The toast is only toasted on one side.  That's laziness on my part. They need to stick to pizza.

Absolutely terrible. I rarely dish out 1 star reviews but this one was asking for it. This place is as chaotic as it can get. No one knows what is happening, the ordering system is messed up, no follow through on orders and I can go on and on..! A simple order for a Barbecue Chicken Pizza which they promised in 10 mins took for ever and my little one went to sleep. No one smiles, everyone looks at you like you are a botheration. Everyone that ordered after me got their food. They promised to call my name which they totally forgot. The gal at the counter would not make eye contact because she knew she messed up.. Major training inputs required.
Good food, beer and okay service.  Wanted to have a pizza but worried I'd have time to eat it while relaxing before my flight.  Overall a good experience but food was average.

Breakfast was good but for airport breakfast it was great!! Service was very good and very prompt. Breakfast potatoes were a little in greasy side but coffee and omelette were very good. Breakfast sandwich was good too.
Great place for quick pizza before getting on plane. They are quick and efficient in the to-go line. Food fresh and pretty tasty for airport food. Staff super friendly too

This CPK is located in the SWA terminal. Although I love CPK's bbq chicken pizza, we weren't in much of a pizza mood, so we opted to get apps. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, chicken dumplings, and shishito peppers. The spinach and artichoke dip was pretty standard. The chips definitely came straight out of a tostitos bag. The honey glaze on the chicken dumplings gave the dish flavor, otherwise the dumplings thenselves would have been bland. My favorite appetizer is the one with the shishito peppers. I always order the shishito peppers as an appetizer at any restaurant that serves them, because I like to compare how each restaurant dresses them up. I enjoyed the oil/salt/seasoning on the shishito peppers of the appetizer. My friend ordered the ginger smash cocktail, and Oof... Really heavy on the ginger.
Food was good. Service was quick, but nothing special. Prices were on par with airport eating.

This was the only positive in the eyesore of the under construction LAX terminal 1. It is new and fresh looking and we barely had to wait for a table. Although if you prefer, they have quick service too.  I got the brie and turkey sandwich and my husband got a bbq pizza. He got beer and I got a citrus cocktail which was made perfectly and much needed after our disaster of a day trip we had. The food took a bit to come out but our waitress was very nice and we were happy to sit there and just rest our feet. I'd definitely eat dinner here again because it tastes great and feels like a little piece of heaven in the middle of such a chaotic airport.

If you like cold pizza and price gouging then you have Come to the right place! Welcome to LA! Oh and we ask that you Pay double for a frozen cheese pizza over what we charge at our ordinary chain eateries in the mall.  But then, we all have business cards and expense accounts and that's really why everyone is in line and ordering. It's a business expense. It's not like that $20 pizza is coming out of your pocket. Stick it to the man! Get two! So when in terminal one waiting for your southwest flight, go ahead and Wait in the line. Order the pizza and soda, sit back and enjoy the people watching. Just remember when you return to fill out that expense report because nothing says "regert" (tattoo commercial joke) like paying for crappy frozen pizza out of your own pocket.  Safe travels.
I'm sorry but $13.83 for a "super spinach & quinoa salad" is ridic. I know it's the airport but sheesh. Feels like the rape pat down I just got from TSA coming through security.
